channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @avocados_ai Also, FYI, I wrote about you: https://t.co/VOD1o1ljvU
@avocados_ai Jewish child shaking lulav and avocado as parents watch proudly, Norman Rockwell style
@InfantaRaquel I had the privilege of meeting — and publishing the memoir of — the man who added the jokes to the film. (Currently very deeply discounted on Amazon.) https://t.co/nO98UaOpVs

@JohnBarnesSF Always with 27 followers and 147 they follow.
@JohnBarnesSF It’s only charitable to assume he’s a subcontractor in a Macedonian troll farm.
@PostingTreyf Hats and caps, however, are immensely useful.
@InfantaRaquel Your occasional reminder that in Oz, guns grow on trees, according to The Tin Woodsman of Oz.
@dceiver @ggreeneva @JoshuaMound Didn’t Tom Wolfe write this for Harper’s circa 1985?

Your occasional reminder that honesty is not always the Orthodox Jewish policy. https://t.co/uKAbCf1D2g
Also note that the Orthodox institutions that provide an excellent secular as well as Jewish education have chosen to side politically with the chassidic scofflaws.
Brilliant. https://t.co/gsHgZVqc1M
@Tzipshmil @nytimes Seems plausible. And like any cultural shift, scary to the olds. The question is why Big Government should get involved.
@ZachWeiner Two kid Batman and Robin analogues with hijinx? And no killer psychopaths?
@tompeyer I hear that more and more, Kurt Busiek is being praised for his art.

@sillyhead I am very looking forward to the side-eye that will be given to Jim’s “romantic” reputation when he appears next season. I suspect that’s the actual reason he’s being brought into the series.
@sillyhead Actually, this puts me in mind of Arthur Waskow's midrashic reclamation of the Torah in “Tales of Tikkun,” particularly the rewrite of the Abraham/Sarah/Hagar throuple.
@sillyhead And then you rewatch The Arena, and you watch a scene where Kirk is being a Kirky-jerky, and you notice that Spock and Uhura seem to be exchanging knowing glances...

Biggest "generation gap" experience I had with my kids was when I was driving a carload of middle school girls to day camp and they were discussing a contestant on America's Got Talent who, like all the boys they knew, wore a yarmulke when he performed. https://t.co/5lJvn4pz55
Most of the girls were enthusiastic about the prospects of the Orthodox Jews, who they obviously wanted to win. My daughter chimed in: "Isn't that a little bit racist?"
@raggedmouths Once religion allowed the Deus to go absconditus, primeval chaos was bound to return.
@TheJewishDream Better three than none.

Pretty sure the episode of Classic Trek that I showed my then middle-school aged daughter, which I soon regretted it as I rewatched it through her horrified eyes, was the classic Nurse Chapel episode "What Are Little Girls Made Of."
So I am very, very glad that SNW seems to share that same reaction as it revisits those characters.
@rmneiss @firefox @moamwater Meanwhile, my bank’s bill pay app — running on a sketchily named third party URL, of course — silently fails on Chrome but works on Firefox.
Good rule. https://t.co/NiblCPXcng
@typolad Meanwhile, I learned from this week’s Jewish Standard that in 64, Shatner was in a film with Claire Booth — who was later married to, and then angrily divorced from, Philip Roth.
@typolad Librarians?
@typolad It’s really amazing. They have one job, and they give it their all.

Rewatching Amok Time. Delicious fun. https://t.co/MRbQ0bQW5p
Of course, the Chapel scene a couple minutes earlier was cringe all around. Which is what SNW is playing against and rewriting.
